intro: Lawrencia squamata, commonly known as the scaly lawrencia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, scaly stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Lawrencia squamata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
